dimensions:
Warp x Weft: 89 x 89 cm (35 1/16 x 35 1/16 in.)
H x W (triangle; width measured at base): 25 x 50.5 cm (9 13/16 x 19 7/8 in.)
title: The Vernaid Bandage
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed on plain weave
description: Triangular bandage with illustrations instructing on the setting of broken bones, printed in black on white. The bandage is marked "Approved by Sir James Cantlie, XBE, FRCS."  Cantlie (1851-1926) is best known for founding the Journal of Tropical Medicine and the London School of Tropical Medicine. During World War I his work centered on the provision and training of ambulance services.
name: Bandage
